availability.p: This electronic edition is published for personal purposes only and should not be shared without permission of it creator.

projectDesc.p: Artist journal pages collected for preservation and to find themes for book. This digital version is an encoded transcription of a pen and ink sketchbook page (page 3), containing handwritten text blocks, questions, and original illustrations.

correction.p: Incorrect use of punctuation and proper nouns will be corrected.

editorialDecl.p: The following customizations have been made to the TEI encoding:

list.item: The div element with the attribute type set to "topchunk" is used contain elements in the top section of the page.
The div element with the attribute type set to "leftchunk" is used contain elements in the left section of the page.
The div element with the attribute type set to "centerchunk" is used contain elements in the center section of the page.
The div element with the attribute type set to "rightchunk" is used contain elements in the right section of the page.
The div element with the attribute type set to "bottomchunk" is used contain elements in the bottom section of the page.

editorialDecl.p: This transcription encodes both textual and visual elements of the original sketchbook page, preserving layout information through the use of zones and facsimile. This digitial work aimes to accurately represent the journal page with illustrations while prioritizing the content of the handwritten text.

category.catDesc: Physiological processes which result in energy, fatigue, health, illness
Related to dreaming, dream states, sleep
Related to Gilles Deleuze's theory of Domain of Immanence
Related to a catalog of machine drawings and paintings that exist in the artist notebooks
Psychological concepts such as attachment theory
Jacques Lacan, French psychoanalyst and psychiatrist
Slavoj Žižek, philosopher primarly from lecture material
John Bowlby, British psychiatrist and psychoanalyst, child development and attachment theory
Related to the arc of desire and death drive

creation.placeName: New York, NY, and Connecticut, USA

div.p: CP alert: Ideas about dream/sleep + creativity I want to create enchanged inner worlds to express the images I get in side when I wake. Where does thie begin? Where do ideas come from? What has to be in play / in order to allow ideas to transcend?
Who cares? Why write about this? When we deconstruct an idea - its like we allow a thousand tiny electrons to unfurl....and new energy is created.

figure.head: Growth of Idea Graphic
figure.figDesc: Technical pen and watercolor image of a snakeplant growing with grass, blue sky and framed in a double box. Either side of the plant extend outside, breaking the spacial box.

body.div:
Manifest content
Tends to rely upon an obsession with the odd.
Made up of subconscious content
Contains conscious content
Check Zizek + Lacan
Domain of Immanence Deleuze - the space where something / ideas reside before becoming real of transcending.te

div.p: Questions: Why do some people create late at night with little sleep? Creating during insomnia why are some afraid to create past dark?
Your personal history + early attachment plays into rhythms, safety, ability to create.

figure.head: Imaginary machines Graphic
figure.figDesc: Pen and watercolor image of a machine with water, on three legs, with a clamp with 6 cylinders, a vertical rod and handle, and a hose that swoops down to the left, cut off. The background colors are a mixture of quinacridone red and cadmium yellow watercolor. The machine is drawn using black technical pen.

figure.head: Traveling Idea Graphic
figure.figDesc: Using technical pen, an image of a box with rounded corners, and "Creative Sphere" in the top half, enciricled by a broken dashed line. There are two diagonal dashed lines in the bottom right quadrant, with a small circle in the bottom right corner. There appears to be three ink marks connecting the "creative sphere" with the two diagonal lines. Outside of the image on the bottom right, are the words "domain of immanence" a Deleuzian term.

div.p:
Unconscious →Latent dream content → Manifest dream content ← conscious•
Sleep is the Biological function that allows for this process to unfouunfold
What are the other functions that support creative process?
